oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Robustness of round-robin differential-phase-shift quantum-key-distribution protocol against source flaws
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mizutani, Akihiro
Imoto, Nobuyuki
Tamaki, Kiyoshi
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quantum Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Recently, a new type of quantum key distribution, called the round-robin differential phase-shift (RRDPS) protocol [Nature 509, 475 (2014)], was proposed, where the security can be guaranteed without monitoring any statistics. In this Letter, we investigate source imperfections and side-channel attacks on the source of this protocol. We show that only three assumptions are needed for the security, and no detailed characterizations of the source or the side-channel attacks are needed. This high robustness is another striking advantage of the RRDPS protocol over other protocols.
Comment: The new version can deal with sending pulses that are classically correlated with each other in an arbitrary manner
